quote: One day your life will flash before your eyes. Make sure it’s worth watching.
author: Unknown

quote: You’re braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: Fear, uncertainty and discomfort are your compasses toward growth.
author: Unknown

quote: When in doubt, choose change.
author: Lily Leung

quote: Doing what you want is freedom, liking what you do is happiness
author: Unknown

quote: When nothing is going right, go left
author: Unknown

quote: Go that way, really fast. If something gets in your way, turn.
author: Charles De Mar (Better of Dead)

quote: Some people are so poor, all they have is money
author: Unknown Graffiti Artist

quote: You are never too old, never too bad, never too late, and never too sick to start from scratch again.
author: Bikram Choudhury

quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
author: ARTHUR SCHOPENHAUER

quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
author: SOCRATES

quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.
author: Bene Gesserit
from Frank Herbert’s Dune

quote: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself, and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard P. Feynman, Nobel Prize–winning physicist

quote: γνωθι σεαυτόν [Know Thyself]
author: Inscription at Temple of Apollo at Adelphi

quote: What gets measured gets managed.
author: Peter Drucker, recipient of Presidential Medal of Freedom

quote: As to methods, there may be a million and then some, but principles are few. The man who grasps principles can successfully select his own methods.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Everything is a miracle. It is a miracle that one does not dissolve in one’s bath like a lump of sugar.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I saw an angel in the block of marble and I just chiseled until I set him free.
author: Michelangelo

quote: It is vain to do with more what can be done with less. (Occam’s Razor)
author: William of Occam

quote: The more technique you have, the less you have to worry about it.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
author: BENJAMIN FRANKLIN

quote: To see the world in a grain of sand, and to see heaven in a wild flower, hold infinity in the palm of your hands, and eternity in an hour
author: William Blake

quote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite
author: William Blake

quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough
author: William Blake

quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings
author: William Blake

quote: I exist as I am, that is enough
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Be curious, not judgmental
author: Walt Whitman

quote: ...the powerful play goes on, and you will contribute a verse
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul
author: Walt Whitman

quote: And your very flesh shall be a great poem
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Behold I do not give lectures or a little charity, When I give I give myself
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enoug
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm
author: Winston Churchill

quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything
author: Mark Twain

quote: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it
author: Mark Twain

quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see
author: Mark Twain

quote: Be careless in your dress if you must, but keep a tidy soul
author: Mark Twain

quote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Discipline is doing what you hate to do, but nonetheless doing it like you love it.
author: MIKE TYSON

quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Love is the most important thing in the world, but baseball is pretty good, too
author: Yogi Berra

quote: It ain't over till it's over
author: Yogi Berra

quote: When you come to a fork in the road, take it
author: Yogi Berra

quote: If you don't know where you are going, you'll end up someplace else
author: Yogi Berra

quote: You can observe a lot by just watching
author: Yogi Berra

quote: In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is
author: Yogi Berra

quote: It's tough to make predictions, especially about the future
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Certain things catch your eye, but pursue only those that capture the heart.
author: Ancient Indian Proverb

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone can see.
author: Confucius

quote: If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on.
author: Sheryl Sandberg

quote: Education costs money.  But then so does ignorance.
author: Sir Claus Moser

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Do what you can, where you are, with what you have.
author: Teddy Roosevelt

quote: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth.
author: William W. Purkey

quote: If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quote: Don’t worry what others are doing. Do you!
author: Russell Simmons

quote: You will meet two kinds of people in life: ones who build you up and ones who tear you down. But in the end, you’ll thank them both.

First shalt thou take out the Holy Pin, then shalt thou count to three, no more, no less. Three shall be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, neither count thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out.
author: Saint Attila, Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch

quote: Everybody wants to go to heaven, nobody wants to die.
You win the first hour of the day, you win the day.
Discipline or Regret. Suffer the pain of discipline or you will suffer the pain of regret.
Plant trees under who’s shade you do not plan to sit.
Detachment is not that you own nothing, but that nothing owns you.
Step from the cave. Some people have a warped perception of who they are:  I am not what I think I am, nor what you think I am, but instead trapped in thinking I am what I think you think I am.
Keep Quiet
author: Papaji

quote: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience, we are spiritual beings having a human experience
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote: JavaScript is an ugly hack of a language, but then again so is English.  Not surprisingly both obtain their power and respect for the same source, reach.
author: Jeff Windsor

quote: Life in itself is neither good not evil, it is the place of good and evil, according to what you make it.
author: Montaigne

quote: Ambition is not a vice of little people.
author: Montaigne

quote: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes most of which never happened.
author: Montaigne

quote: He who establishes his argument by noise and command shows that his reason is weak.
author: Montaigne

quote: The thing I fear most is fear.
author: Montaigne

quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
author: Montaigne

quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
author: Montaigne

quote: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears.
author: Montaigne

quote: He who would teach men to die would teach them to live.
author: Montaigne

quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
author: Montaigne

quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Montaigne

quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education
author: Mark Twain
